I tell you that if you expect the blessing of God to rest upon you, you must put into the treasury that which will support the interests of the cause in different places. . . . The amount that goes from the Battle Creek Church to the General Conference will go for the universal wants of the cause in different places where the work must be built up.--Ms 11, 1891, pp. 6, 7. ("Remarks at Michigan Conference Meeting," September 3, 1891.) 

Released January 18, 1977.
